703579f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Flatbush Avenue
703579f-a.text:
59 Clarkson Ave., north side, between Flatbush and Bedford Aves., built
in 1850, owned by John D. Burke, who kept the Abbey at Fulton Street at one
time. This house was demolished before 1936.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BP REPRODUCED.
703579f-a.folder: Clarkson Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703580f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Flatbush Avenue
703580f-a.text:
72 Clarkson Ave., south side, between Flatbush and Bedford Aves. The
frame house in the center, is the John Lott's home, said to be in 1800 on
the Nag le Farm.
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
NAY BE REPRODUCED.
703580f-a.folder: Clarkson Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704260f-a.title: Brooklyn: Flatbush Avenue - Woodruff Avenue
704260f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave., north from Woodruff Ave.
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
704260f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Woodruff Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
